alert.note: Alert for Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 9:28PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Williamson and northeastern Travis Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 928 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bartlett to Round Rock. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Austin, Round Rock, Georgetown, Pflugerville, Taylor, Granger, Windemere, Anderson Mill, Hutto, Bartlett, Thrall, Weir, Granger Dam, Coupland, Laneport, Wells Branch, Waterloo, Jonah, Sandoval and Rices Crossing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for south central Texas.
